english: mouth; opening; entrance; measure word for people

etymology.description: 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth; opening; entrance; measure word for people")
etymology.interpretation: This character visually represents an open mouth, suggesting notions of speaking or an opening of some kind. Its intuitive design closely aligns with its meanings involving openings or entrances.

examples.pinyin: Wǒ xiǎng hē shuǐ (Wǒ xiǎng hē shuǐ)。

examples.chinese: 这口井(這口井)很深(很深)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè kǒu jǐng hěn shēn (Zhè kǒu jǐng hěn shēn)。
